I think it is important for at least the test methods to be
"untouchable", =
especially if you are releasing the Abstract Test to
unknown users.  Making=
 setUp and tearDown final is not quite as
important to me, as long as they =
get run.  You could let the Concrete
Tests override them but you would have=
 to have a way to ensure that the
overriden versions call super().  You cou=
ld use set a flag in the
abstract test's setUp and then fail if you don't s=
ee the flag at the
beginning of each test.

I have actually been using the =
createXXX abstract method to do any
initialization specific to the Concrete=
 Test.  Sometimes that looks a
little clumsy to me, so using a non-final se=
tUp method may be the better
long term solution.

On Wed, 2002-02-06 at 10:=
12, Francois Beausoleil wrote:
    Hello Eric,
    
    I have been doing s=
omething similar.  I had not thought about making setUp(),
    tearDown() a=
nd the tests final though.  I agree that this is a very good idea. 
    Now=
, you only have to provide a Template Method so that subclasses of the
    =
abstract test can do their own initialization.
    
    Have a nice day !
 =
   Francois Beausoleil
